Text.Value: Not hiding, silly - performing. And what better audience is there than the entirety of Baldur's Gate?

EditorData.NodeContext: Geastures behind her. Big smile, affectionate, happy to be here and to be alive

Text.Value: You and I are going to take this city by storm - I know it.
BIG trouble. The most trouble you've ever been in.

EditorData.NodeContext: teasing, pretending to be serious, maybe hands on hips

Text.Value: I'm shocked you haven't been arrested for making all that noise.
Sorry - I'm only alive because of you, and I am grateful. I just... need some time.
A minor detail.
I had something for you, my very first lute, but I seem to have fallen prey to the city's sticky fingers. Kindly imagine I've given it to you, yeah?

EditorData.NodeContext: little sad but also knows it's not the end of the world. Cheeky and fun at the end.

Text.Value: And I you. Never thought I'd live to perform for the greatest audience in the Realms - the entirety of Baldur's Gate.

EditorData.NodeContext: Geastures behind her to the view of the city. Affectionate, cares for the player and is happy to see them.

Text.Value: Good to know where I should avoid.
What are you doing up here?
Stay alert - this city is full of enemies.
Oh dear, am I in trouble?
Lakrissa lets me practice up here when she's on shift downstairs. She's too good to me.

EditorData.NodeContext: shy smile (her and lakrissa are a thing).

Text.Value: Is this because I broke your lute that one time?
That's wonderful, Alfira. I'm proud of you.
Cross your arms, looking unimpressed.
And it's because of you that I dared dream big enough.
I thought coming to the city would help me figure out my life - what I wanted to do without music. But I just feel more lost.
I've forgiven you for that - just about. But no - that's not why.
Here - my very first lute, tuned to perfection. Thought you'd appreciate it when I'm rich and famous.

EditorData.NodeContext: generic handing motion. Emotive, trying to act light and teasing at end, but this is a big deal for her to hand this over - it's one of the most important things in the world to her.

Text.Value: Alfira, I could crush you one hand.
I'm glad to see you safe, Alfira.
I'm going to send all my students to you, obviously.
You and Lihala's names in bold? Hm - I like it. Deal.
Thank you - that means a lot. I wanted to tell you first because, well, you inspired me to do it.
Maybe dream a bit smaller.
Har, har - not all of us can be big-time adventuring bards.

EditorData.NodeContext: rolling her eyes with a smile

Text.Value: You're going to make me cry, damn you.
We're technically on top of the Elfsong Tavern.
How dare - the clouds have been most appreciative of my performance.

EditorData.NodeContext: acting shocking, teasing, having fun with player

Text.Value: You seem a bit down - everything all right?
Your grumpy face may scare the others, but I'm afraid I'm made of sterner stuff.
I could stay up here all day - the view is something else, isn't it?
Thinking about my old teacher - Lihala. She would have been so proud to see me here, but what's the point?
I've decided I'm not going to perform in the Elfsong - mainly because only the Elfsong itself is allowed to perform.

EditorData.NodeContext: second line as an aside, maybe said a bit quieter (the ghost of the elfsong itself is the only thing allowed to perform in the elfsong)

Text.Value: It's you! Look at us - we made it to the city! We made it to the Elfsong Tavern.

EditorData.NodeContext: delighted, over the moon to see the player.

Text.Value: Take care, my friend. Thank you for helping a bunch of ragtag tieflings in a druids' grove find their way home.
I'm not a bard - not anymore. I thought coming here would help me figure out my life, but I just feel more lost.
Not really. My teacher would have been so proud to see me here. But what's the point?
I know - it never stops, does it?
Well - I think you should name your school after me, don't you?
Take care, my friend. Thank you for helping a stumbling bard in a druids' grove find her spark again.
Why are you hiding away up here?
Oh, hush - I know you love me really.
I mean, what better audience could a bard ask for than the entirety of Baldur's Gate?

EditorData.NodeContext: Geastures behind her. Big smile, cheerful

Text.Value: But you - I have a bone to pick with you, oh brave adventurer.

EditorData.NodeContext: teasing, pretending to be serious, maybe hands on hips or a wagging finger.

Text.Value: Ah - you startled me. I was lost in my own world.

EditorData.NodeContext: sad smile, holding her arms - looking away

Text.Value: I'm going to open up a school of bards - the best in the Realms! To usher in a new age of magic and musicianship.

EditorData.NodeContext: excited, this is the happiest and most confident we've ever seen her

Synopsis: The end of Alfira's arc. We meet alfira at the top of the elfsong tavern
